intro: Psorospermum nervosum var. trichostyle, commonly known as the hairy-styled psorospermum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and distinctive hairy structures on its floral parts. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with lanceolate leaves that are often hairy on both surfaces. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, round berries that are edible. The varietal form trichostyle is distinguished by its elongated, hairy stamens, which contribute to its unique botanical appearance.
